task.title: Install the License Server as a Windows Service

keywords.indexterm: Licenselicense server installed as Windows service

step.cmd: Ensure that a up-to-date version of Java is installed on the server machine.
step.info:
oXygen License Server uses the following rules to determine which installed version of Java to use:
If you install using the native Windows installer, which installs a version of Java as part of the oXygen License Server installation, the version in the jre subdirectory of the installation directory is used.
Otherwise, if the Windows environment variable JAVA_HOME is set, oXygen License Server uses the Java version pointed to by this variable.
Otherwise the version of Java pointed to by your PATH environment variable is used.

step.cmd: Add oXygenLicenseServer.exe manually in the Windows Firewall list of exceptions. Go to Control Panel System and Security Windows Firewall Allow a program or feature through Windows Firewall Allow another program and browse for oXygenLicenseServer.exe from the oXygen License Server installation folder.
Download the Windows installer of the license server from the URL provided in the registration email message containing your floating license key.
Enable the Windows service on the machine that hosts the license server, either during installation or at a later time with the service management batch scripts (installWindowsService.bat).

info.p: If you want to manually install, start, stop, or uninstall the server as a Windows service, run the following scripts from command line. On Windows you have to run the commands as Administrator.

ul.li: installWindowsService.bat [serviceName] - install the server as a Windows service with the name serviceName. The parameters for the license key folder and the server port can be set in the oXygenLicenseServer.vmoptions file.

info.note: If you do not provide the serviceName argument, the default name, oXygenLicenseServer, is used.
